com.myscript.atk.mltw

Class MultiLineTextWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • com.myscript.atk.mltw.MultiLineTextWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, ViewManager, ViewParent

    public class MultiLineTextWidget
extends RelativeLayout
    The multi-line text widget main controller and entry point. It gathers the callbacks/API for application, ink capture widget, ITC and stroking/scrolling layout.

    • Method Detail

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the handwriting recognition engine and resources.

        Warning: You won't be able to interact with the widget after calling this method.

        See Also:
        #configure(String, String[], String[], byte[])

      • configure

        public void configure(String locale,
             List<String> resources,
             List<String> lexicon,
             byte[] certificate)
        Configures the handwriting recognition engine.

        This function is non-blocking and returns immediately. Please note that the widget content will be cleared if the given locale differs from the previously configured locale.

        Configuration is a lengthy process that may take up to several seconds, depending on the handwriting resources to be configured. It is recommended to setup a configure listener to detect the end of the configuration process.

        When the device is rotated, Android completely recreates the UI without restarting the process of the application. You should configure the new instance of MultiLineTextWidget by calling this function again.

        Parameters:
        locale - String representation of the handwriting recognition locale.
        resources - List of paths to handwriting resource files.
        lexicon - List of user lexicon entries. May be null.
        certificate - Byte array containing the handwriting recognition certificate.
        See Also:
        OnConfigureListener, release()

      • getText

        public String getText()
        Retrieves the current widget text.
        Returns:
        The current widget text.

      • getWords

        public List<Word> getWords()
        Retrieves all words of the widget. The output is a list of word, each containing the possible candidates.
        Returns:
        A list of words.
        See Also:
        Word

      • replaceWord

        public void replaceWord(Word word,
               String text)
        Replaces a word in the text.

        This function will do nothing if :

        • The given word is null or is not part of the widget text
        • The given text is null or is not one of the word candidates

        This function will call the text changed callback as well as the selection callback after the word has been replaced.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to change
        text - Replacement text string.
        See Also:
        OnTextChangedListener#onTextChanged(String), OnSelectionChangedListener.onSelectionChanged(Word), Word

      • insertLineBreak

        public void insertLineBreak(Word word,
                   int relativeIndex)
        Inserts a line break at the given index. If a line break already exist at the given index, nothing happens upon this call.
        Parameters:
        word - The reference word of the line break insertion.
        relativeIndex - Character index of the line break insertion point inside the word.
        See Also:
        Word

      • insertSpace

        public void insertSpace(Word word,
               int relativeIndex)
        Inserts a space inside a word at the given index. If the given index is not inside a valid word, nothing is processed.
        This will automatically change the widget edition mode to Mode.CORRECTION by selecting the part of word following the created space.
        Parameters:
        word - The reference word of the space creation.
        relativeIndex - Character index of the space creation point inside the word.
        See Also:
        Word, Mode

      • removeSpace

        public void removeSpace(Word word,
               int relativeIndex)
        Removes a writing space at the given index by joining the surrounding words, removing the possible line breaks. If the space to remove is large or contains a line break, the words are just brought closer on the same line, otherwise they are joined together. This will automatically change the widget edition mode to CORRECTION by selecting the part of word after the removed space. If the given index is not at one of the edges of the given word, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        word - The reference word of the space removal.
        relativeIndex - Character index of the space removal point inside the word. It should be 0 or word length otherwise nothing will happen.
        See Also:
        Word, Mode

      • reflow

        public void reflow()
        Moves all the words to optimize the vertical writing space. Words will be reordered in lines in a way that remove all unused spaces. This call also changes the edition mode of the widget to Mode.WRITING.

      • reflow

        public void reflow(Word word)
        Moves words on the same line and after the given one to optimize the vertical writing space. Words will be reordered in lines in a way that remove all unused spaces.
        Parameters:
        word - The reference word of the reflow.
        See Also:
        Word

      • setWritingMode

        public void setWritingMode()
        Changes the widget edition mode to Mode.WRITING.

        Mode.WRITING is intended for the user to input text continuously at the end of the widget. Hence, the input view is automatically scrolled down after the user writes if the auto scroll ratio is matched (and auto scroll option activated). No word is highlighted nor selected in the widget.

        See Also:
        Mode, setAutoScrollRatio(float), setAutoScrollEnabled(boolean), OnSelectionChangedListener

      • setCorrectionMode

        public void setCorrectionMode(Word word)
        Changes the widget edition mode to Mode.CORRECTION by selecting the given word.

        Mode.CORRECTION is intended for the user to correct already written words. Hence, there is always a selected and highlighted word around which the input view is automatically centered (if auto scroll option activated).

        Parameters:
        word - The word to select. If the word is invalid, the selection will be cleared.
        See Also:
        Word, Mode, setAutoScrollEnabled(boolean), OnSelectionChangedListener

      • setInsertionMode

        public void setInsertionMode(Word word,
                    int relativeIndex)
        Changes the widget edition mode to Mode.INSERTION by creating writing space at the given index.

        #MODE_INSERTION is intended for the user to write inside already written text. Hence, no automatic scroll is triggered and the space created for the user to write is highlighted.

        Parameters:
        word - The reference word of the space creation.
        relativeIndex - Character index of the space creation point inside the word.
        See Also:
        Word, Mode, setInsertionDrawable(Drawable)

      • setGestureEnabled

        public void setGestureEnabled(int gesture,
                     boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables the management of a given gesture. By default all gestures are enabled. Detected gestures will trigger a call to the gesture listener except for Gesture.ERASE and Gesture.OVERWRITE that are managed internally to the widget and thus don't trigger any callback to the top-level application.
        Parameters:
        gesture - The gesture to enable/disable.
        enabled - to enable the gesture detection, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Gesture, addOnGestureDetectedListener(OnGestureDetectedListener), removeOnGestureDetectedListener(OnGestureDetectedListener), isGestureEnabled(int)

      • isGestureEnabled

        public boolean isGestureEnabled(int gesture)
        Checks if the given gesture is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        gesture - The gesture to check.
        Returns:
        true if the gesture is currently enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Gesture, addOnGestureDetectedListener(OnGestureDetectedListener), removeOnGestureDetectedListener(OnGestureDetectedListener), #setGestureEnabled(Gesture, boolean)

      • setInputViewHeight

        public void setInputViewHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the widget input view. The input view is made of the view capturing the ink as well as the one displaying the strokes.
        Parameters:
        height - Height of the content view in pixels.

      • setAutoScrollEnabled

        public void setAutoScrollEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Activates/deactivates the auto scroll behavior.

        If enabled two automatic scroll behaviours can be noticed:

        • When the user stops writing, a down scroll may be triggered after a delay if page is filled, to leave some writing space at the bottom of the widget view.
        • When selecting a word via setCorrectionMode(Word) the widget automatically centers the view around this word.

        Parameters:
        enabled - to enable the auto-scroll behavior, false to deactivate.
        See Also:
        setAutoScrollRatio(float)

      • setAutoScrollRatio

        public void setAutoScrollRatio(float ratio)
        Sets the auto scroll ratio. This is the ratio of the height of the widget that needs to be filled with text for the widget to scroll down. For instance, setting a value of 30% means that as soon as a user writes below 30% of the top of the widget view, the automatic scroll will trigger.
        Parameters:
        ratio - Ratio between 0 and 1.0f.
        See Also:
        setAutoScrollEnabled(boolean)

      • scrollTo

        public void scrollTo(Word word)
        Moves the scrolled position of the widget around the given word, so that it is visible at the top of the widget.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to scroll to.
        See Also:
        Word, centerTo(Word)

      • centerTo

        public void centerTo(Word word)
        Move the scrolled position of the widget around the given word, so that it is centered inside the widget.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to scroll to.
        See Also:
        Word, scrollTo(Word)

      • setExpandRatio

        public void setExpandRatio(float ratio)
        Sets the auto expand ratio. This is the ratio of the height of the widget that needs to be filled with text for the widget to expand its size. For instance, setting a value of 30% means that as soon as a user writes below 30% of the top of the widget view, the automatic expansion will trigger.
        Parameters:
        ratio - Ratio between 0 and 1.0f.
        See Also:
        setOnExpandListener(OnExpandListener), OnExpandListener, setInputViewHeight(int)

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the widget contains any word/strokes.
        Returns:
        true if the widget does not contain any strokes/words.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all the strokes and words in the widget. This call will trigger an onTextChanged event.

      • save

        public byte[] save()
        Serializes the widget content into a byte array.
        Returns:
        A byte array representing the widget content model.
        See Also:
        load(byte[])

      • load

        public void load(byte[] model)
        Deserializes the given byte array into the widget content. This will trigger an onTextChanged event.
        Parameters:
        model - A byte array representing the widget content model.
        See Also:
        save(), load(List), load(List, RectF)

      • load

        public void load(List<Path> paths,
        RectF bounds)
        Loads the widget content with a list of paths to be rendered as strokes.
        Parameters:
        paths - A list of paths to be rendered as strokes.
        bounds - Bounds of the paths.
        See Also:
        load(byte[]), load(List)

      • load

        public void load(List<Stroke> strokes)
        Loads the widget content with a list of strokes.
        Parameters:
        strokes - The strokes to load.
        See Also:
        Stroke, load(byte[]), load(List), getStrokes()

      • getStrokes

        public List<Stroke> getStrokes()
        Gets the list of Stroke of the current page.
        Returns:
        The list of Stroke of the current page.
        See Also:
        Stroke}, load(List)

      • getImage

        public Bitmap getImage(boolean withBackground,
              boolean exactHeight)
        Retrieves the content of the widget as a Bitmap object.
        Parameters:
        withBackground - If true then the current background will also be exported.
        exactHeight - If true then the Bitmap will be sized to fit exactly the contained stroke or text. Otherwise it will have the full size of the input view (set via setInputViewHeight(int)
        Returns:
        A Bitmap representing the widget content.

      • clearHighlightedWords

        public void clearHighlightedWords()
        Clears all highlighted words in the widget.
        See Also:
        highlightWord(Word)

      • highlightWord

        public void highlightWord(Word word)
        Highlights a word in the widget by changing its stroke color (focused state set is used).
        Parameters:
        word - The word to highlight.
        See Also:
        setInkColor(ColorStateList)

        Overrides:
        isEnabled in class View

      • setGuidelines

        public void setGuidelines(int first,
                 int gap)
        Defines the guidelines spacing in the widget. Guidelines allow a better recognition success if the user follows them to write.
        Parameters:
        first - The height in pixels of the first guideline to be displayed.
        gap - The gap between two consecutive guidelines (line height) in pixels.

      • setGuidelineDrawable

        public void setGuidelineDrawable(Drawable drawable)
        Sets the drawable for the guidelines.
        Parameters:
        drawable - Drawable for the guideline.

      • setInkColor

        Sets the color of the ink.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the ink.
        See Also:
        setInkColor(ColorStateList)

      • setInkColor

        public void setInkColor(ColorStateList colors)
        Sets the color of the ink.
        Parameters:
        colors - List of colors for various states. States used are default/selected & focused.
        See Also:
        ColorStateList, setInkColor(int)

      • setInkThickness

        public void setInkThickness(float thickness)
        Sets the thickness of the ink.
        Parameters:
        thickness - Thickness of the ink in pixels.

      • setInkAnimationEnabled

        public void setInkAnimationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Activates/deactivates the ink animation during the recognition process. This is only supported since Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich (android-14).
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to activate the ink animation (default is true).
